metadata.title: CVE-2024-43847 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wifi: ath12k: fix invalid memory access while processing fragmented packetsThe monitor ring and the reo reinject ring share the same ring mask index.When the driver receives an interrupt for the reo reinject ring, themonitor ring is also processed, leading to invalid memory access. Sincemonitor support is not yet enabled in ath12k, the ring mask for the monitorring should be removed.Tested-on: QCN9274 hw2.0 PCI WLAN.WBE.1.1.1-00209-QCAHKSWPL_SILICONZ-1

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
